sentences.english: Bus routes and railways, both overground and underground, converged on the station.
sentences.chinese: 公共汽車線路和地上地下路軌都在該站交匯。

sentences.english: Ride the rails along deep river canyons and over high mountain passes.
sentences.chinese: 沿着深河峽谷和高山通行的路軌。

sentences.english: I too would fain be a track-repairer somewhere in the orbit of the earth.
sentences.chinese: 我極願意做那地球軌道上的某一段路軌的養路工。

sentences.english: Recirculating twin ball tracks in the screw and on the rails provide greater accuracy.
sentences.chinese: 在循環球螺桿雙軌道和在路軌上提供更大的準確性。

sentences.english: The monotonous rhythm of wheels clicking on the trails soon lulls you to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 車輪碾過路軌發出的單調“咔嗒”聲，很快催人入睡。

sentences.english: Yes, that means there’s nearly nine miles of track here.
sentences.chinese: 對，這意味着這段路軌將近有九英里那麼長。

sentences.english: I lay and listened to the rain on the canvas and the clicking of the car over the rails.
sentences.chinese: 我躺着傾聽帆布上的雨聲和列車在路軌上開的軋軋聲。

sentences.english: A man walks across flooded railway tracks after heavy rains in Mumbai, India.
sentences.chinese: 在印度孟買，大雨過後，一個人走過被淹的鐵路路軌。

definition: to drive a vehicle/movement of vehicles
aerial work platform (e.g. cherry picker or scissor lift)/lift/elevator
to access/to transfer passengers between two railway lines
to pull up (stop one's vehicle)/to park/(of a machine) to stop working/to stall
dangers spring up all around (idiom); surrounded by perils
Hong Kong LRT (Light Rail Transit) (abbr. for 輕便鐵路|轻便铁路)
